description:
Creating instance with quantum network manager without specifying tenant id, the following exceptions occurs

2012-02-08 19:30:55,181 ERROR nova.rpc [-] Exception during message handling
(nova.rpc): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/rpc/amqp.py", line 249, in _process_data
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     rval = node_func(context=ctxt, **node_args)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/quantum/manager.py", line 483, in get_instance_nw_info
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     net_tenant_id = net_tenant_dict[network['uuid']]
(nova.rpc): TRACE: KeyError: 'b84a365e-69ce-4ca5-adf2-a63f1067f22b'
(nova.rpc): TRACE:

This can be fixed with the following patch

 nova/network/quantum/manager.py |    5 ++---
 1 files changed, 2 insertions(+), 3 deletions(-)

diff --git a/nova/network/quantum/manager.py b/nova/network/quantum/manager.py
index 8f2aa0a..91722cb 100644
--- a/nova/network/quantum/manager.py
+++ b/nova/network/quantum/manager.py
@@ -473,9 +473,8 @@ class QuantumManager(manager.FloatingIP, manager.FlatManager):
         for vif in vifs:
             if vif.get('network_id') is not None:
                 network = db.network_get(admin_context, vif['network_id'])
-                net_tenant_id = net_tenant_dict[network['uuid']]
-                if net_tenant_id is None:
-                    net_tenant_id = FLAGS.quantum_default_tenant_id
+                net_tenant_id = net_tenant_dict.get(network['uuid'],
+                                    FLAGS.quantum_default_tenant_id)
                 network = {'id': network['id'],
                            'uuid': network['uuid'],
                            'bridge': '',  # Quantum ignores this field
title: Key error exception with quantum manager

comments.content:
Creating instance with quantum network manager without specifying tenant id, the following exceptions occurs

2012-02-08 19:30:55,181 ERROR nova.rpc [-] Exception during message handling
(nova.rpc): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/rpc/amqp.py", line 249, in _process_data
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     rval = node_func(context=ctxt, **node_args)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/network/quantum/manager.py", line 483, in get_instance_nw_info
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     net_tenant_id = net_tenant_dict[network['uuid']]
(nova.rpc): TRACE: KeyError: 'b84a365e-69ce-4ca5-adf2-a63f1067f22b'
(nova.rpc): TRACE:

This can be fixed with the following patch

 nova/network/quantum/manager.py |    5 ++---
 1 files changed, 2 insertions(+), 3 deletions(-)

diff --git a/nova/network/quantum/manager.py b/nova/network/quantum/manager.py
index 8f2aa0a..91722cb 100644
--- a/nova/network/quantum/manager.py
+++ b/nova/network/quantum/manager.py
@@ -473,9 +473,8 @@ class QuantumManager(manager.FloatingIP, manager.FlatManager):
         for vif in vifs:
             if vif.get('network_id') is not None:
                 network = db.network_get(admin_context, vif['network_id'])
-                net_tenant_id = net_tenant_dict[network['uuid']]
-                if net_tenant_id is None:
-                    net_tenant_id = FLAGS.quantum_default_tenant_id
+                net_tenant_id = net_tenant_dict.get(network['uuid'],
+                                    FLAGS.quantum_default_tenant_id)
                 network = {'id': network['id'],
                            'uuid': network['uuid'],
                            'bridge': '',  # Quantum ignores this field
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~yamahata

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/4628
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Thanks for reporting the bug! However, I do not believe this fix is correct.

Can you show the commands you were using to trigger this? I suspect you were using the os-create-server extension (i.e., the --nic option with the nova client) and that you were passing in a network UUID that was neither:
owned the tenant-id spinning up the VM
owned by the default tenant

Essentially, the dict we are accessing in the original version *should* have all of the valid entries in it (in some cases, those valid entries map to a project_id of Null, which is why we have the check).

I believe the real problem is actually something I'm already working on fixing in Quantum itself (or rather, some Quantum plugins). This bug (https://bugs.launchpad.net/quantum/+bug/942713) causes the validate_networks() method of QuantumManager to miss the fact that the network specified is not valid, meaning the list of networks is passed to allocate_for_instance(), which is where that exception is triggered. Stated another way, the right solution is to prevent the dict from being accessed with a key that is not a member, not to handle the fact that the key may not be in the dict.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~danwent

comments.content:
Note: the following Quantum patch will fix this issue, if my hypothesis is correct: https://review.openstack.org/#change,4647

I do not believe this issue will require Nova changes.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~danwent
